LibraryFaq.Question: What is this document?
LibraryFaq.Answer: This document tries to answer frequently asked questions about ivata groupware.

LibraryFaq.Question: What browser do I need?
LibraryFaq.Answer: There is no specific browser that we use, though most of the pages have been thoroughly tested with Mozilla, and the Internet Explorer.

LibraryFaq.Question: Can people outside the company see my article on the internet?
LibraryFaq.Answer: No. Every page is protected by the login process.

LibraryFaq.Question: How long should my item be?
LibraryFaq.Answer:
As long as it needs to be :-)

We have items ranging from just a few sentences to tens of pages. The only exception to this is please don’t post two short items one after another, where the subject content is similar in each case.

LibraryFaq.Question: What subject can I write about?
LibraryFaq.Answer: Well anything that is to do with your company. Looking at some of the existing items should give you some ideas.

LibraryFaq.Question: On which items may I post comments?
LibraryFaq.Answer: You may and should post comments on all items about which you have a feeling. Go for it! Tell us what you really think!

LibraryFaq.Question: What do I do if I have a really long comment? Should I post a new item?
LibraryFaq.Answer: That depends. If the original item was written a while ago and you have some additional information (rather than just an opinion) then it might make sense to post a new item. Otherwise, post the comment to the item directly. Long comments are automatically shortened with a little link at the end of the comment to show the whole text.

LibraryFaq.Question: What is ivata groupware?
LibraryFaq.Answer: ivata groupware is a series of pages which are internal to your company. It's a private site where the firm can share information, and record progress as a team.

LibraryFaq.Question: May I write an item to the library?
LibraryFaq.Answer: Yes, yes, yes! Everyone who has access to ivata groupware should feel free to post articles about matters of interest to the company.

LibraryFaq.Question: How will people know I have written a comment?
LibraryFaq.Answer:
Whenever you send a comment to an item, all users of your company ivata groupware automatically receive an email containing the comment and a link to the item it is about. If you reply to an original comment, then the comment you are replying to is also shown in the email.

Note: only the users of your site will see the comment. Other companies who also have ivata accounts have no acess to your information.

LibraryFaqCategory.Name: general
LibraryFaqCategory.Description: This section contains the most basic questions about using the ivata groupware.

LibraryFaqCategory.Name: security & access
LibraryFaqCategory.Description: All matters concerning accessing the system and who can see what you write are answered here.

LibraryFaqCategory.Name: library items
LibraryFaqCategory.Description: Questions about submitting library items, and the sort of content they should offer.

LibraryFaqCategory.Name: comments
LibraryFaqCategory.Description: Look here for the who, what when and why of comment posting.

LibraryItem.Title: Frequently Asked Questions
LibraryItem.Summary: Frequently Asked Questions about this ivata groupware

PersonGroup.Name: administrator
PersonGroup.Description: Every user who is administrator belongs to this group.

PersonGroup.Name: everyone
PersonGroup.Description: Every user belongs to this group, contain other user groups

PersonGroup.Name: private_user
PersonGroup.Description: This group contain all private groups of each user

PersonGroup.Name: address_book
PersonGroup.Description: This group contain all private ABs and all public ABs

PersonGroup.Name: private contacts
PersonGroup.Description: This group contain all private address books for each user

PersonGroup.Name: shared contacts
PersonGroup.Description: This group contain all public address books

PersonGroup.Name: public
PersonGroup.Description: This is the addressbook everyone can see.

PersonGroupRightDetail.Name: PERSON_GROUP_MEMBER
PersonGroupRightDetail.Description: view, amend, add or delete group memberships. This applies both to people within groups and groups within groups.

PersonGroupRightDetail.Name: LIBRARY_ITEM_TOPIC
PersonGroupRightDetail.Description: view, amend, add or delete library items on the basis of their topic.

PersonGroupRightDetail.Name: LIBRARY_COMMENT_TOPIC
PersonGroupRightDetail.Description: add amend or remove comments, based on the topic of their items

PersonGroupRightDetail.Name: DIRECTORY
PersonGroupRightDetail.Description: view, amend, remove and add to directories

Setting.Name: calendarDefaultView
Setting.Description: number of the default view to show in the calendar (defined in IndexFormConstants)

Setting.Name: calendarFinishHour
Setting.Description: finish hour of views in calendar

Setting.Name: calendarFirstWeekDay
Setting.Description: 0 for sunday, 1 for monday

Setting.Name: calendarStartHour
Setting.Description: start hour of views in calendar

Setting.Name: demoVersion
Setting.Description: if this application is demo

Setting.Name: emailAttachmentSizeLimit
Setting.Description: The maximum size of an attachment in kB

Setting.Name: emailAuthentication
Setting.Description: use email host to authenticate if true; otherwise use database

Setting.Name: siteLoginDebugPassword
Setting.Description: provide debug information on logging in

Setting.Name: emailDefaultFormat
Setting.Description: Constant format as defined in ...jsp.format.FormatConstants

Setting.Name: emailEnable
Setting.Description: Setting this to false will disable sending mails completely.

Setting.Name: emailFolderDrafts
Setting.Description: this mail folder will store the precomposed messages, drafts

Setting.Name: emailFolderInbox
Setting.Description: The name of inbox folder

Setting.Name: emailFolderSent
Setting.Description: folder for storing sented mails

Setting.Name: emailFolderTrash
Setting.Description: The name of trash folder

Setting.Name: emailHeaderForwardText
Setting.Description: Header applied to forwarded emails. Use {0} for the sender(s), {1} for the recipients (to, not cc/bcc), {2} for the message subject, {3} for the sent date.

Setting.Name: emailHeaderReplyText
Setting.Description: Header applied to forwarded emails. Use {0} for the sender(s), {1} for the recipients (to, not cc/bcc), {2} for the message subject, {3} for the sent date.

Setting.Name: emailHeaderReplyHTML
Setting.Description: Header applied to replied emails in HTML format. Use {0} for the sender(s), {1} for the recipients (to, not cc/bcc), {2} for the message subject, {3} for the sent date.

Setting.Name: emailHeaderForwardHTML
Setting.Value:
-----Forwarded Message-----
From:{0}
To:{1}
Subject:{2}
Date:{3}
Setting.Description: Header applied to forwarded emails in HTML format. Use {0} for the sender(s), {1} for the recipients (to, not cc/bcc), {2} for the message subject, {3} for the sent date.

Setting.Name: emailHost
Setting.Description: name/ip address of the mail server

Setting.Name: emailHostSmtp
Setting.Description: the host to use for sending emails

Setting.Name: emailLibrary
Setting.Description: this is the special user on the email system who will recieve all replies to notifications about library submissions.

Setting.Name: emailLibraryPassword
Setting.Description: password to log in as the library user

Setting.Name: emailLibraryUser
Setting.Description: username for replies to the library system

Setting.Name: emailFolderNamespace
Setting.Description: Some IMAP servers (read: courier) provide shared and personal namespaces. If specified (not empty), this is this the name of the namespace to use for personal folders. Drafts, sent and trash will all be created in this folder. The inbox depends on the setting emailInboxPath, which is taken to be an absolute path from the store.

Setting.Name: emailPort
Setting.Description: email port used to connect

Setting.Name: emailReplyIndent
Setting.Description: The character(s) to prepend to each line of forward or reply emails

Setting.Name: emailScriptServerEnvironment
Setting.Description: this contains all environment variables for the script mail server. there should be combinations of name=value pairs, seperated by the new line character ( n)

Setting.Name: emailSignatureForward
Setting.Description: If true, appends signatures to forwarded emails.

Setting.Name: emailSignatureHtml
Setting.Value:
Composed using ivata groupware - team communication software.
Visit www.ivata.com for details
Setting.Description: The text to automatically appear at the foot of composed emails (HTML format).

Setting.Name: emailSignatureReply
Setting.Description: If true, appends signatures to replies.

Setting.Name: emailSignatureText
Setting.Value: __________________________________________________ composed using ivata groupware - team communication software. Visit http://www.ivata.com for details.
Setting.Description: The text to automatically appear at the foot of composed emails. (Text Format).

Setting.Name: emailSubjectForwardPrefix
Setting.Description: This string is prepended to the subject lines of forwarded messages.

Setting.Name: emailSubjectForwardSeperator
Setting.Description: This string seperates multiple forwarded emails.

Setting.Name: emailSubjectReplyPrefix
Setting.Description: This string is prepended to the subject lines of replied to messages.

Setting.Name: emailTitle
Setting.Description: title used in the email windows

Setting.Name: fileFolderTemporary
Setting.Description: all the temporary files and directories will be stored here

Setting.Name: fileMaxSize
Setting.Description: maximum file upload size

Setting.Name: groupAdministrator
Setting.Description: administrator group = complete access over entire system

Setting.Name: guiButtonSpacer
Setting.Description: This is the space between button groups under each window

Setting.Name: guiMenuCharWidth
Setting.Description: width allowed for each character in menues

Setting.Name: guiMenuItemHeight
Setting.Description: height allowed for each menu item

Setting.Name: guiMenuItemOffset
Setting.Description: offset before all the menu items to try to fix MSIE

Setting.Name: guiMinimumTextareaHeight
Setting.Description: Setting this to the minimum size allowed for textarea fields.

Setting.Name: guiShortcutPause
Setting.Description: How long to wait between move over events, for dynamic shortcuts.

Setting.Name: guiShortcutStyle
Setting.Description: Dictates how the shortcut menues (on the left hand side) behave.

Setting.Name: guiToolBarSpacerWidth
Setting.Description: width of a spacer in the toolbar

Setting.Name: i18nDateInput
Setting.Description: This is the input mask for entering dates

Setting.Name: i18nDateInputDisplay
Setting.Description: The format of the dates after the user entered them to a date field.

Setting.Name: i18nDateLastWeekDay
Setting.Description: this is the SimpleDateFormat text used for relative dates when the date compared comes on the previous week of the current date

Setting.Name: i18nDateLong
Setting.Description: this is the long SimpleDateFormat text used for long dates which need not show the year

Setting.Name: i18nDateLongDay
Setting.Description: this is a long SimpleDateFormat test used for long dates which need to show the working day

Setting.Name: i18nDateLongYear
Setting.Description: this is the long SimpleDateFormat text used for long dates which need to show the year

Setting.Name: i18nDateShort
Setting.Description: this is the short date SimpleDateFormat text used, just containing numbers

Setting.Name: i18nDateShortToday
Setting.Description: date to use in short relative date format for today.

Setting.Name: i18nDateShortYear
Setting.Description: this is the short date SimpleDateFormat text used, just containing numbers

Setting.Name: i18nDateShortYesterday
Setting.Description: date to use in short relative date format for yesterday.

Setting.Name: i18nDateThisAfternoon
Setting.Description: this is the SimpleDateFormat text used for relative dates when the date compared comes on the afternoon of the current date

Setting.Name: i18nDateThisEvening
Setting.Description: this is the SimpleDateFormat text used for relative dates when the date compared comes on the eveing of the current date

Setting.Name: i18nDateThisMorning
Setting.Description: this is the SimpleDateFormat text used for relative dates when the date compared comes on the morning of the current date

Setting.Name: i18nDateWeekDay
Setting.Description: this is the SimpleDateFormat text used for relative dates when the date compared comes on the week of the current date

Setting.Name: i18nDateYesterdayAfternoon
Setting.Description: this is the SimpleDateFormat text used for relative dates when the date compared comes on the afernoon of the day before the current date

Setting.Name: i18nDateYesterdayEvening
Setting.Description: this is the SimpleDateFormat text used for relative dates when the date compared comes on the evening of the day before the current date

Setting.Name: i18nDateYesterdayMorning
Setting.Description: this is the SimpleDateFormat text used for relative dates when the date compared comes on the morning of the day before the current date

Setting.Name: i18nEncoding
Setting.Description: character set encoding used

Setting.Name: i18nLanguage
Setting.Description: language to be used throughout the system. currently, this feature is not used.

Setting.Name: i18nLocaleCountry
Setting.Description: locale country code (see http://www.chemie.fu-berlin.de/diverse/doc/ISO_3166.html)

Setting.Name: i18nLocaleLanguage
Setting.Description: locale language code (see http://www.ics.uci.edu/pub/ietf/http/related/iso639.txt)

Setting.Name: i18nTimeInput
Setting.Description: The format of the time input.

Setting.Name: i18nTimeInputDisplay
Setting.Description: The format of time displayed in a time input field after the user entered it.

Setting.Name: i18nTimeLong
Setting.Description: this is the long time SimpleDateFormat text including seconds

Setting.Name: i18nTimeShort
Setting.Description: this is the short time SimpleDateFormat text without seconds

Setting.Name: i18nTimeZone
Setting.Description: Current timezone used to display times and dates.

Setting.Name: libraryCommentLength
Setting.Description: number of bytes shown under article b4 its cut short with a full view link

Setting.Name: libraryCommentSpacer
Setting.Description: the number of pixels to indent each level of the library comment tree

Setting.Name: libraryHome
Setting.Description: number of articles to show on the homepage

Setting.Name: libraryNotificationContentComment
Setting.Value:
To {1}: {0} has replied to your comment:
New Comment:
{4}
{5}

Original comment:
{2}
{3}
Setting.Description: this is the string surrounding the notification for a comment. Use {0} for the user name of the original comment author, {1} for the author of the new comment, {2} for the title of the original comment, {3} for the content of the original comment, {4} for the comment subject, {5} for the (HTMLified) text of the comment and {6} for the comment url.

Setting.Name: libraryNotificationContentCommentAmend
Setting.Value:
to {1}: {0} has amended the reply to your comment:
Amened Reply:
{4}
{5}

as Reply To:
{2}
{3}

Setting.Name: libraryNotificationContentCommentAmendStrange
Setting.Description: this used when user did change not his comment

Setting.Name: libraryNotificationContentItem
Setting.Value:
{0} has written a new library item entitled {1}:
{2}
Setting.Description: this is the string surrounding notification of a new library item. Use {0} for the user name of the new item author, {1} for the item title, {2} for the item summary and {3} for the item url.

Setting.Name: libraryNotificationContentItemAmend
Setting.Value:
{0} has amended the library item entitled {1}:
{2}
Setting.Description: this is the string surrounding notification of an amended library item. Use {0} for the user name of the new item author, {1} for the item title, {2} for the item summary and {3} for the item url.

Setting.Name: libraryNotificationContentItemReply
Setting.Value:
To {1}: {0} has commented on your library item:
New Comment:
{4}
{5}

Library Item Summary:
{2}
{3}
Setting.Description: this is the string surrounding the notification for a new comment thread in reply to a library item. Use {0} for the user name of the original author, {1} for the author of the new comment, {2} for the title of the original library item, {3}for the summary of the library item, {4} for the subject of the comment, {5} (HTMLified) text of the comment and {6} for the comment url.

Setting.Name: libraryNotificationContentItemReplyAmend
Setting.Value:
To {1}: {0} has amended the comment on your library item:
Amended Comment:
{4}
{5}

Library Item Summary:
{2}
{3}
Setting.Description: this is the string surrounding the notification for an amended comment thread in reply to a library item. Use {0} for the user name of the original author, {1} for the author of the new comment, {2} for the title of the original library item, {3}for the summary of the library item, {4} for the subject of the comment, {5} (HTMLified) text of the comment and {6} for the comment url.

Setting.Name: libraryNotificationContentType
Setting.Description: the type used in email notifications

Setting.Name: libraryRecent
Setting.Description: number of articles to show on the recent articles list

Setting.Name: pathButtonsDirectory
Setting.Description: directory where all the buttons are stored

Setting.Name: pathContext
Setting.Description: the stem of the url to the site

Setting.Name: pathLibraryITemImages
Setting.Description: path to article images

Setting.Name: pathMenuItemImages
Setting.Description: Stores the path for the short cut images, in the left frame. Note: must have a trailing slash!

Setting.Name: pathScriptMailServer
Setting.Description: path for the scripts which drive the mail server

Setting.Name: pathTopics
Setting.Description: path to topic images

Setting.Name: siteAdminEmail
Setting.Description: the email address for users to address any queries about the site to.

Setting.Name: siteCheckQuota
Setting.Description: set to true to enable the quota display in the top right frame.

Setting.Name: siteDefaultForward
Setting.Description: This is the default url which will appear when the user first logs in.

Setting.Name: siteLogo
Setting.Description: full path to the logo for the title page

Setting.Name: siteName
Setting.Description: this is the name of the site as used when welcoming the user in the login screen, for example

Setting.Name: siteQuotaLimit
Setting.Description: limit for free space of quota, in MegaBytes

Setting.Name: siteTitle
Setting.Description: this is the main title for the site, which is used in all the header tags

Setting.Name: siteVersion
Setting.Description: current version of ivata groupware. used by the install script.

Setting.Name: siteWelcomeText
Setting.Value:
This is a members-only area, so you will have to kindly login to enjoy the full benefits of ivata groupware.
In order for this program to function properly, please make sure pop ups are enabled in your browser.
Setting.Description: Text which appears in the login screen. This is one setting which the users cannot override.

Setting.Name: emailAddressHost
Setting.Description: host used to append to email addresses generated from user names

Setting.Name: userNamePrefix
Setting.Description: Prepended to user names to get the actual system user name.

Setting.Name: siteDebug
Setting.Description: Set to true to display error messages on the screen. Otherwise, they are sent to the administrator.

Setting.Name: siteTheme
Setting.Description: Set to the name of the theme to use by default for the whole site.
